intro: Galium parisiense var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release minute seeds, aiding in its spread. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
